messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Sashimono Back Banners
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/26/2009 7:13:00 AM Eastern Daylight Time, carpenterj12000@yahoo.co.uk writes: Can  anyone tell me please, when the Sashimono came into
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/26/2009 7:13:00 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
carpenterj12000@... writes:

Can anyone tell me please, when the Sashimono came into general use?



According to Stephen Turnbull in _Samurai Heraldry_ (Osprey Publishing),
the sashimomo came into use in the 16th century. Prior to that, samurai
would fight under a distinctive common banner.

Should you be interested in finding the book, the ISBN is 1-84176-304-7.

Hope that helps...

--R.M.B.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
